intro: Ditaxis cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ditaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its simple, narrow leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. The plant is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
